body.p:
Boyd Co Ky
Oct 16th 1865
To His Excellency
Gov. Thos E Bramlett
Chris Pop was fined in the Boyd Circuit Court: Sixty dollars for keeping a Tipling House:

Mr Pop is a Foreigner: and not acquainted with our laws: & usages: and took out a Merchants Licence to Liquor: and on the representations of the Parties ^that^ they wanted a Pint of Liquor for a sick person he sold it to them and they took it off the premises and the adjoining premises, and drank it, this is the Case: Judgment went by default: Mr Pop is a most estimable and hard working man: and the last man to wilfully break the Law: therefore we hope You will remit the said fine.
The facts stated I am satisfied are true from statements made to me. & I concur therefore in the Petition.

C. Howell
Geo. Greenhill
J G Black
Ch Ruths
Wash. Long
John Burgraf
John Niner
Wilhem Runkels
E, P, Davis
J M. Summers
Jasper Bowling
